tutorialData.copy:
welcome to the tutorial!
use ← and → to proceed
 or click the eject button to exit.

these are oscillators
each of them makes sound.
drag the volume slider to the right to hear it.

you can also drag the pitch slider
to the right to make the sound higher.

you can also choose from the three soundwaves
 which will change the overall tone of each oscillator.

left is a 'sine' wave, it's smooth
middle is a 'square' wave, it's sharp
right is a 'triangle' wave, it's harsh.

these are audio 'effects'
they change the character of your sound.
tremolo is a volume ping pong.
delay makes the sound echo.
reverb makes your sounds seem further away.
distortion increases overall nastiness.

play around with the settings to
come up with combinations you like.

try out the generative mode
(the synth will play itself if it's not muted).

don't worry it'll never be louder
or higher pitched than your original settings.

top tip: it'll sound best if you have a wide variety
of effects and oscillator settings

click again to exit generative mode
and get your original settings back.

like what you've come up with?
you can save it here once you have an account.
...which you can sign up for and access here.

not your first time?
load some previous settings here.

it's worth noting: effects can get wild!
hit here to reset all sounds
and rest your ears when needed.

you can also mute it for a little break
your effects will fade out, which might sound cool?
double click your oscillators to rename them! this gets saved as well.
have fun, and get weird!
